entry.title: Eyes of Buddha (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Eyes of Buddha (example pictured) is a Buddhist symbol commonly painted on stupas in Nepal?

entry.title: Herb Roedel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Herb Roedel retired from professional football after only one season to become an engineer?

entry.title: The Duchess of Montesquiou-Fezensac (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Oskar Kokoschka's painting The Duchess of Montesquiou-Fezensac was confiscated by the Nazis after his work was labelled "degenerate"?

entry.title: Barry Downs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Canadian architect Barry Downs contributed to the redevelopment of the Expo 86 site in Vancouver, the largest private development in North America at the time?

entry.title: announced a €100-billion investment (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chancellor Olaf Scholz has announced a €100-billion investment in the German armed forces?

entry.title: its San Diego TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when the sale of its San Diego TV station failed, United States International University asked some of its employees to wait to pick up their paychecks?

entry.title: Cursed to Golf (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Cursed to Golf has been referred to as the "Dark Souls of golf" due to its difficulty?

entry.title: Mama Lee (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mama Lee lived for more than a decade on a cruise ship?
